intro: Cacalia ruficoma, commonly known as the red-stemmed cacalia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive reddish tint, while the flowers are small and yellow, often grouped in clusters. Cacalia ruficoma is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along streambanks.
